questions.text: Identify the SQL statement that retrieves all columns from the table named 'employees'.
Arrange the SQL keywords in the correct order to retrieve the 'name' column from the 'customers' table.
What is the correct SQL statement to update the salary of an employee with id=1234 to 70000?
answers: UPDATE employees SET salary = 70000 WHERE id = 1234;
SET salary = 70000 WHERE id = 1234 IN employees;
MODIFY employees SET salary TO 70000 WHERE id = 1234;
CHANGE salary TO 70000 FOR id = 1234 IN employees;
correctSequence: UPDATE employees SET salary = 70000 WHERE id = 1234;

questions.text: Arrange the SQL keywords in the correct order to delete rows in the 'products' table where the price is less than 10.
Which SQL statement is used to create a new table named 'orders' with columns 'id' (integer) and 'order_date' (date)?
answers: CREATE TABLE orders (id INTEGER, order_date DATE);
MAKE TABLE orders (id INT, order_date DATE);
NEW TABLE orders (id INT, order_date DATE);
BUILD TABLE orders (id INT, order_date DATE);
correctSequence: CREATE TABLE orders (id INTEGER, order_date DATE);
